intro: Didissandra cordatula, commonly known as the heartleaf didissandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically orange or red in color, which contain the seeds. Didissandra cordatula is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
